Title: Implementation evaluation of project management software in IT/IS directorate of Kompas Gramedia Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Teguh, M.H., Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 1530, Indonesia; Harisno, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 1530, Indonesia
Abstract: This study aimed to evaluate the results of the implementation of Project Management Software at IT/IS Directorate of Kompas Gramedia that had been done by using the Technology Acceptance Model Framework. Factors such as the Perceived Ease of Use, Perceived Usefulness, Familiarity, and Subjective Norm Intention assessed may influence users to utilize Project Management Software. The results of the evaluation then were used as the basis of recommendations for improvements that might be made to the successful implementation. Based on the analysis, it is found that Subjective Norm Intention most affects users, whereas most influenced Perceived Usefulness, Perceived Ease of Use. © 2015 American Scientific Publishers. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Project management software; Smart PLS; Technology acceptance model
References: Fonchamnyo, D., (2013) International Journal of Economics and Finance, p. 166; Pikkarainen, T., Pikkarainen, K., Karjaluoto, H., Pahnila, S., (2004) Internet Research, p. 224; Lee, C., Wan, G., (2010) Including Subjective Norm and Technology Trust in the Technology Acceptance Model: A Case of E-Ticketing in China, , The Database for Advances in Information System; Fishbein, M., Ajzen, I., (1975) Belief, Attitude, Intention, and Behavior: An Introduction to Theory and Research, , Addison-Wesley; Ajzen, I., (1991) Organizational Behaviour and Human Decision Process, p. 179; Davis, F., (1993) International Journal Man-Machine Studies, p. 475; Davis, F., (1989) MIS Quarterly, p. 13; Mohamed, A., (2009) Project Management Software–Essential Guide, , http://www.computerweekly.com/feature/Project-management-software-Essential-Guide, RetrievedJuly 2013, from ComputerWeekly.com; Vernakesh, V., Davis, F., (2000) Management Science; Jaradat, M.-I.R., (2012) International Journal of Information Technology and Web Engineering, p. 34; Çakmak, A., Benk, S., Budak, T., (2011) International Journal of Economics and Finance, p. 107; Lim, W., Ting, D., (2012) Modern Applied Science, p. 49; Nayak, L., Priest, L., White, A., (2010) Universal Access in the Information Society, p. 367
